videoOverlayText: Cultivating joy, relief and peace in people everywhere
aboutText:
We are entrepreneurs with an unrelenting passion for great cannabis.

With our unique cultivation techniques, we strive to grow flowers that set the standard for clean, pure, quality cannabis. But we don’t stop there. We see the responsibility in front of us – to define an emerging industry through thought leadership, innovative product development and global partnerships.

From Canada to the world, we’re cultivating joy, comfort and peace in people everywhere.

We are New Maple. Grow with us.

leadershipTeam.name: Tegan Adams
leadershipTeam.bio: Tegan completed her BSc & MSc at the University of British Columbia in Trade Policy & Agricultural Economics. She has over ten years experience working in management specializing in start-ups and emerging industries. Starting in the cannabis industry in 2014, she worked as a management consultant to successfully guide the creation & launch of over a dozen of the first publicly traded and privately held legal cannabis companies in Canada. Following her accomplishments, Tegan pitched and co-launched Canada's first cannabis university course, teaching over 400 students in the first year of enrolment. She was later recruited to work as a Director with a Health Canada accredited lab in Toronto where she was involved in reviewing quality systems and business plans for over one hundred cannabis companies. Now a program developer & course lecturer with Seneca@York’s new Cannabis Regulation & Quality Assurance Legalities course she is considered an expert in the cannabis industry; committed to leading New Maple to expand its brand presence through global partnerships.

leadershipTeam.name: Chetan Dhotre
leadershipTeam.bio:
Chetan Dhotre has 20 years of global experience in operations, manufacturing and engineering. Chetan has an MBA from the Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto, and is a mechanical engineer. He has led global teams spanning 16 facilities in the Americas, Europe and Asia in diverse industries including, biotechnology, composites, and chemical manufacturing. He has proven success in leading complex multimillion dollar capital programs and turning underperforming operations to best in class. 

As COO at New Maple Holdings, he is responsible for the corporate operations of the company as well as the construction and retrofit of New Maple’s facilities.

leadershipTeam.name: Don-Shane Taylor
leadershipTeam.bio: Over seven years of operational experience in Canada’s federally legal cannabis sector. Licensing success in two leading Canadian LPs: MedReleaf and Northern Green Canada.

leadershipTeam.name: Rhonda Gerrits
leadershipTeam.bio:
Rhonda Gerrits has over 18 years experience in food and regulated industries. Rhonda holds a BSc in Food Science focused in Microbiology and Quality from the University of Guelph. She is certified in HACCP and SQF as well as Canadian food labeling guidelines and environmental monitoring. With experience in the FDA and CFIA regulated Dairy industry, Rhonda brings a wealth of knowledge on implementing continuous improvement and maintaining a quality management system. 

Before joining New Maple, Rhonda was a Professor in the Institute of Food Processing and Technology at Conestoga College, teaching in the Food Processing Technician and Food Safety, Quality Assurance graduate program.

leadershipTeam.name: Mark Ian Mitchell
leadershipTeam.bio:
Mark Ian Mitchell has over 33 years of experience in regulatory affairs. Mark spent twelve years as a Primary Products Inspector for the CFIA where he participated in the very first HACCP training and implementation at several Federal establishments in Ontario.

Switching from the Federal to Provincial systems to work with the Meat Inspection Program(MIP), Ontario Ministry of Food and Rural Affairs (OMAFRA), Mark went from the front line to the head office were he lead a technology team and implemented strategies to modernize data collection and secure data storage for all of the food regulatory inspection regimes in the Province. Furthering his leadership skills, Mark took the position of Area Manager Stratford where he managed a team of 18 who were located in 40 different third-party locations. In his twenty years of leadership and management, Mark lead initiatives which transformed the MIP (Meat Inspection Program) resulting in him being formally recognized through the Premieres Amethyst Award for dedicated efforts to Food Safety and the Environment.

At New Maple, Mark is an integral part of the team - Maintaining our focus on quality assurance and control.

leadershipTeam.name: Karim Nehme
leadershipTeam.bio: Karim Nehme is the President, Co-Founder of New Maple Holdings. Karim holds an HBA from the University of Toronto and an MBA from the Schulich School of Business (with distinction). He is skilled at implementing ISO 9001 quality assurance standards and has experience preparing bids for USD 20 billion + worth of projects with AECOM.

leadershipTeam.name: Miki Batch
leadershipTeam.bio: Miki Batch is the Vice President of Business Development and Founder of New Maple Holdings. Miki holds an HBA in Economics and a Certificate in Business Analysis from the University of Toronto. Miki has specialized international experience in the energy, construction and food processing sectors. He also has rounded experience in the operation of private medium sized enterprises. As one of the main Founders of New Maple - Miki brings his family ties to the Carribean as well as high net worth contacts around the world.

footprintLocations.bulletPoints:
• Joint Venture agreement.
  • 1.25 million sq. ft hydroponic greenhouse.
  • 45 minutes to the US-Canada border.
footprintLocations.description:
A State-of-the-Art Hydroponic Greenhouse

New Maple and Allegro are partnering under a long-term joint venture to convert and operate Allegro’s existing 1.25 million sq. ft greenhouse for cannabis cultivation.

The Allegro greenhouse was designed with quality and efficiency in mind and includes cutting-edge systems which we believe will translate into great cannabis at a fair and competitive price.

Allegro is owned and managed by third generation greenhouse growers who have been active members of Ontario’s agricultural community since the 1950s.
footprintLocations.title: ALLEGRO

footprintLocations.bulletPoints:
• Wholly Owned Licensed Producer
  • 23 acre, riverfront site: custom built.
  • 1.5 hours from downtown Toronto.
footprintLocations.description:
A Wholly Owned Licensed Producer

Situated on a picturesque river-front property, Canwe is dedicated to growing top quality cannabis in small batches so that our team can give each crop the attention it deserves.

We custom designed Phase 1 from the ground up to ensure that the quality, safety, and reliability of our product is never compromised. With off-grid power, well-drawn water, and environmentally protected meadows, Canwe is our dream facility come to life.
footprintLocations.title: CANWE

footprintLocations.bulletPoints:
• Equity stake.
  • Licensed Producer on 12 acre industrial site.
  • 10 minutes from Toronto Pearson Airport.
footprintLocations.description:
A Federally Licensed Cannabis Producer

Northern Green Canada is a Brampton-based LP producing and selling indoor hydroponically-grown medical and adult-use cannabis. New Maple provided consulting services to NGC and is a minority equity holder in the company.

Located minutes from Pearson International Airport, NGC is strategically situated on a prime industrial site serviced by 5 major highways. With ample room to expand on site, NGC plans to become a premier cultivator and exporter of cannabis products that meet the highest Canadian and international production standards.
footprintLocations.title: NORTHERN GREEN CANADA

investorsBlocks.text:
Private firms typically have a longer-term strategic outlook as compared to their public company counterparts.

As a private company, New Maple is focused on growing its operations organically while developing sustainable business models that drive value creation and profitability in the long run.
With only one class of common shares, New Maple’s share structure is simple and transparent.

technicalTeamIcons.text: Over 30 years of combined federal cannabis cultivation experience
Successfully helped license and operate several of Canada’s leading LPs
Proven track record of high-yielding, award-winning flower

technicalTeamIntro:
More than just growers

New Maple’s technical team are unlike any other in the industry. With shared experience at a number of LPs including MedReleaf, Flowr, and Northern Green Canada, each member has a proven track record of excellence in cannabis production and processing, giving New Maple unparalleled seed-to-sale in-house expertise.

advisoryBoard.bio: Dr. Riseman received his PhD from The Pennsylvania State University in Horticulture (1997) followed by a Post Doctoral Fellowship with the Danish Institute of Agricultural Sciences working on plant stress physiology.  He then began a tenure-track professorship at the University of British Columbia, Faculty of Land and Food Systems. He received tenure in 2007 based on his expertise in plant breeding and genetics, plant tissue culture, plant nutrition, and sustainable production systems.  Recently, he obtained a Health Canada Cannabis Research License to conduct research with in vitro technologies designed to enhance germplasm performance.  In addition to his academic interests, he is a founding member of the plant nutrition company Active AgriSciences and does specialized cannabis consulting.
advisoryBoard.name: Dr. Andrew Riseman
